website_summaries.verdict: Though not the fastest on the market, the WD Elements' large capacity makes it an excellent deal considering its low price.
pros: The WD Elements Portable drive offers a large amount of storage space for a low cost
Its simple design allows it to work well with computers, game consoles and other type of hosts
cons: You have to pay extra to use its included backup software after the introductory 30-day trial
The drive has no security features and carries a short warranty of just one year

customer_reviews.title: WD Blue WD60EZRZ Drives Inside The Enclosure
customer_reviews.text: FYI If anyone's interested I purchased two of these in 6TB and both had the WD Blue WD60EZRZ drive inside. () The enclosure is relatively easy to pry off even without destroying the case so can reuse at a later date if needed. For some reason this drive and enclosure is actually a fair bit cheaper that just the bare drive on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Raymond A. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great portable storage with no need for additional power. PC, Mac, Xbox One or PS4.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic portable external drive. I've purchased two of these, and another few with smaller capacity but identical model in every other way. I've got them as a Time Machine drive on a Mac, a removable backup on a PC and a 4TB drive attached to my Xbox One and they all work fantastic. Fast and reliable, I've had one for over 4 years, the rest are newer but have never had any problems with them at all. They don't require external power on any of my devices, including a MacBook, Xbox One, PC, PS4 and iMac. You can format the drive any way you like so it will work in almost any situation. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: J Shulman

customer_reviews.title: Sad story of delivery woes & malfunctioning drives
customer_reviews.text: First attempt at delivery failed! Second got through OK, but on setting them up, both drives, (I ordered 2), were not working. I tried on 3 different computers, but to no avail. Still Amazon's return policy is superb.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Too complicated to contact
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a faulty data lead. Hard Drive is great but to speak with WD, too much effort and gave up. Easier to buy another lead. All I wanted was to send a message that the lead wasn't working properly. I'm using the Drive with another lead from a previous purchase. Have several Drives and they've been great but this time the lead was faulty. How hard can it be to contact someone without being forced to pick boxes that offer replacements or refunds. I just want a lead... Grrrr
customer_reviews.author: Mr L.Turner

customer_reviews.title: Just leaving this here
customer_reviews.text: You get two years warranty and it works just like you would expect, the case is plastic and would seem to work great as a usb drive, from what I’ve seen the HDD inside are just like normal sata harddrive, some white, some red, but the white ones are also reds in disguise
customer_reviews.author: SignedAdam

customer_reviews.title: A repackaged Item
customer_reviews.text: Didn't get around to using this drive. It was an item that was carefully repackaged and sent to me masquerading as a new item. Sharp practice from Amazon. I've sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: John McGloin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hard drive.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect as a playstation or xbox's external hard drive. The games installed on this drive will actually load around 25% faster than the ones on both of the console's inbuilt hard drives as they run at a faster speed. (the consoles have a 5400rpm drive, compared to this 7200rpm drive) Western digital are well known as an industry leader in hard drives and reliability so it should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: david507

customer_reviews.title: Dead already?! 5 star for amazon return policy though
customer_reviews.text: Dead already?! I was using it with my macbook pro and one day I bumped it slightly while it was connected and working. Since then it became to misbehave and today it is finally dead. I hate spinning disks with needle writing data on it. So fragile, we are 2018 for f... sake. Could they stop making this disks already. They are selling such unreliable stuff and the nano technology is there for many years. Money, money, money...all because of f.... profit. Edit: 5 stars for amazon service though - I got money refunded.
customer_reviews.author: Lana

customer_reviews.title: An excellent drive
customer_reviews.text: An excellent drive you can literally fit in your pocket. I'm currently using it with a Mac although I couldn't format it, I had to use a PC using the ExFAT format, the default NTFS is read only on the Mac. It fits discreetly on my desk with just the USB cable plugging into the Mac, no separate power cable needed. Mine will probably stay connected at home but if you're traveling with a laptop and need decent storage it's ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Paulos

customer_reviews.title: 7th time of using it, its stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I use two at a time to back up my laptop for a backup, So on the 7th time of using the hard drive it won't transfer files, used a few leads so definitely duff. About 500mb on it, luckily backed up. Will be asking Amazon for a refund. Luck of the draw or poor product? not sure, but bought a toshiba instead
customer_reviews.author: Paul Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: YET ANOTHER WD HARD DRIVE DIES ON ME
customer_reviews.text: Fully do NOT recommend this make or model of External Hard Drives. In the last 12 months two have died on me, one after only 3 months, the other 12 months. I have had a loss rate of 25 percent of WD drives over the past 10 years. They are (second to Lacie) the most unreliable drives I have had. They were not running 24 hours a day, nor were they carried around from one place to another. Nor did they overheat as they were working in cool enviroments.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph West

customer_reviews.title: No SATA port for direct PC connection
customer_reviews.text: WD hard drives are in my experience repairing computers, the absolute best. Although a big drawback with this particular model if you open it up, is the internal connection is not a standard SATA, therefore if the USB port breaks the entire hard drive is dead. If for any reason such as a harddrive failure you need to connect it directly to a PC to recover files, this would also be an issue, as you would only be able to use the usb interface. I knew this before I bought the harddrive, but the price at £58 was excellent and worth the trade off.
customer_reviews.author: L. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this device
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back-up device in September 2019 and connected it as advised by the instructions. I have just had my P.C. crash and found that the Elements device saved nothing at all. Checked the web for advice and found loads of people had bought this and it didn't work. Additionally, they were being told to download all kinds of other stuff in order to make it work, I'm absolutely disgusted and hope that Amazon is aware of this
customer_reviews.author: Pauline Porter

customer_reviews.title: Works straight out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived before I was expecting it. Well packaged - secure and protected, but not over the top. It's formatted for Windows, but as a Mac user I use Paragon and had no problems recognising the drive and copying files to it. It is physically smaller than I was anticipating, it is compact and will make an excellent backup drive and host for my Plex server. Previous drives have failed over the years, so will be looking to buy another as an archive, which I will save to every month or so, - just in case. All in all, ​it promises to be a very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Richards

customer_reviews.title: Really irritating noise!
customer_reviews.text: The drive appears to work well with my MacBook, but it pulses all the time and sends vibrations through my desk. It took me a while to figure out what the noise was, but it's definitely the drive and it's incredibly irritating and distracting.
customer_reviews.author: James B

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable piece storage equipment.
customer_reviews.text: Worked straight from the box (on a Windows 10 machine), used to store video files and can handle the editing of them via the PC and software with no problems. Also has many GBs of Music in FLAC format, again giving no problems as to how they are used and edited. Thoroughly Recommended as an all round storage device and very reliable. Although it has an on/off switch, you really just need to plug t into the PC and the mains (it is mains powered) and it will go on and off whenever the PC does.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great bit of kit and YES it does work with Mac's
customer_reviews.text: This drive works exactly as it should I connected it to my Mac ran disk utility formatted it and bingo. (anyone who can't make this work with a Mac really should get a typewriter, forget computers and cry themselves to death). I plugged it into my Time Capsule and now I have 8TB in total online. Time machine found it and started backing up my Macs. Took 10 Mins at most.
customer_reviews.author: I Am Spartacus !

customer_reviews.title: Good for a 2 weeks then not working
customer_reviews.text: I have been using external hard drives from various companies in the past. This one worked like a charm for the first 2 months; however from last 3 days, I cannot somehow connect it to anything. There is a buzzing sound (of it starting) but then it just stops. Such a shame that I got a faulty unit. (I never really give one star and I still feel bad but I have to give this one star as this did not even last me one month).
customer_reviews.author: Anil Kumar

customer_reviews.title: now the product works fine but it should not say suitable with mac OS ...
customer_reviews.text: This external hard drive does exactly what it says! however beware as I had hours of frustration in reformatting due to the fact that I'm a mac user and have high Sierra. This hard drive is not a brand new model and therefore you have to go into your terminal and its a lot of effort i just didn't need. Im fairly savy with tech having studied IT but in the end a hard to find article online solved my issue, now the product works fine but it should not say suitable with mac OS when it clearly is not to start with.
customer_reviews.author: Connor W.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, very fast and affordable for this capacity.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive for backing up data - my older 1.5TB drive wasn't really big enough any more. This drive is fast - seems to sustain up to around 200MB/s - and seems very reliable. It does make a whining noise and takes a long time to spin up, but I think this is normal for a drive of this size - desktop size. Note: This drive doesn't appear to support SMART, which is the only thing I'm annoyed about, but other than that it is excellent, and I would recommend it as long as you don't need SMART support.
customer_reviews.author: Hamish McIntyre-Bhatty

customer_reviews.title: 10.5TB usable storage
customer_reviews.text: Bought to upgrade my media collection storage space on my PC. I purchased the 12tb model. It's important to note that there is only about 10.5TB of usable space on it. It requires its own power supply (plug included), and connects to your computer via USB. As for portability, it's portable enough to be carried around in say a laptop case but I would recommended keeping it at home or in the office, and left plugged in. The transfer speeds are ok, not the best (slower than my WD black drive). Ultimately, it suits what I was looking for; large storage capacity for media files.
customer_reviews.author: ARMACUN

customer_reviews.title: Hope for the best
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of this sized drives I've bought. This one I bought despite having had problems with the first. I'm not clear why the first required reformatting a couple of times but I'm hoping that it won't happen again. I've used WD drives for years and had few problems which is why I tend to stick to the brand. Moving to these larger capacity drives seems a logical move, but it's difficult to know if a drive is going to fail so, if you buy one, buy two using one to back up the other.
customer_reviews.author: Lockers

customer_reviews.title: SOOO SLOOOOW
customer_reviews.text: OK, this is for the Elements 12TB. First off, you lose over ONE TB of capacity to formatting, 10.9 TB left, straight out of the box. Next, it is so slow!! You see that claimed 140MBPS above?? Bollocks, I transferred 2TB and it never broke 98MBPS, off of an internal drive that gives over 160MBPS. This is using a Gen2 3.1 USB port. That 2TB took all afternoon and beyond midnight, I had to leave the PC running all night to finish it. I didnt intend to, but it is so slow, I am going to shuck it and see if it works any better internally. I'll get back to you.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Cretin

customer_reviews.title: Bargain price
customer_reviews.text: As always super fast delivery been a prime member , tested and all works perfect ( test before removing the HDD ) . Please only remove the HDD if you want to give up your warranty . I buy the drives in enclosures because the savings can be upto 100% ? yes insane but like i said you give your warranty up the minute you open the enclosures . But as a bonus you do find a top end WD red or a white label drive inside the 8TB plus models . This 8TB model had a WD white label build date 12/18 inside
customer_reviews.author: Dezzy

customer_reviews.title: DAYS TO SAVE DATA - AVOID. WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Well for me it will take days to download and save my data to this backup. My computer it seems does not have the USB3, but 2 or something and this means it creeps along at a snails pace 30/mb second. A few hundred GB takes hours. I'd rather I bought something that I could put windows on and get away from the dog slow cable and get a speedy slave drive thing going, but no. AVOID. WASTE OF MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: John Henry Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps failing when being written to and then becomes corrupt ...
customer_reviews.text: Keeps failing when being written to and then becomes corrupt. Reformetting (when it works) can clean it bu them what's the point as you lose everything!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Champion

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. It's been over one year and I am still happy with the product. Use it on a daily basis. Does what it says, simple as that.
customer_reviews.author: Chetak

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but is slow
customer_reviews.text: Brought this to replace my ageing WB Elements desktop external HDD. Didn't realise however just how slow these 2.5inch external HDD's were so returned it in favour of a SSD solution. Still a good purchase for storing data if you don't mind waiting for it to transfer and being powered from the USB is a bonus. For desktops though and for moving large amounts of data quickly avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Cruze

customer_reviews.title: NOT PS4 Compatible
customer_reviews.text: This item is sold as PS4 compatible, bit along with its Seagate equivalent it isn't. Very temperamental leading to intermittent error messages advising that the storage device has been incorrectly removed - when it hasn't. It has now corrupted our PS4's hard drive leading to a loss of a lot of paid for content. We will be taking this up with Amazon. Stay away from this item for your PS4.
customer_reviews.author: blueskychris

customer_reviews.title: Failed to work from delivery.
customer_reviews.text: This 4TB drive was not recognised by my PC. Seems to be faulty. I recently bout a similar 2TB drive from the same manufacturer that works ok so far. I can only conclude that quality control is passed on to the customer. A disapointing waste of time and not good for the longer term prospects of the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: JeffD

customer_reviews.title: Second hard disk dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: It may be my bad luck, but I have just had to send back a second WD 4 TB Elements Portable Hard Drive because it doesn't work. This has never happened to me before and I have to wonder if these large capacity hard disks are tested before despatch and whether they are as reliable as previous models.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Robin J J Moseley

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Plug it in and it works. It requires mains power, supplied via a plug adapter. It uses a USB3 cable - both supplied Its pre formatted NTFS, so if you have something other than a PC running Windows you may need to reformat it. Speed is good, but of course depends on the power of the PC and the size of the file being moved. With a new disk and a large file I got 160M. I have always found WD disks reliable, so if you want to store HD movies this is a good choice. If you compare £ per TB for all the sizes you find they work out the same, so buy the biggest one.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Durable Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hard drive to save movies onto and it is great in my opinion. It has a sleek design and is very small which makes it easily portable. The one terrabyte storage capacity is plenty big enough However, it still uses the old USB mini type B which is less durable than the new type c cable. This hard drive is great for a variety of different uses and after comparing this to the Seagate external hard drive that I also own, I would say that they are very similar, but this has the edge because it feels more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Family

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply built, tiny-tiny light to indicate its working. After 4-5 hours of backing up data, it asked to have check-disc run. Did it. After an hour it asked to be re-formatted. Re-booted my PC. No luck. Re-formatted and thus got my data off the drive. Would I trust this drive another minute? This was the second portable external drive to fail on the first day. Th first failed 2 days prior! Genuine WD? I wonder. They are the best or amongt the best out there. Refunded. Big deal. I lost a lot of my time! No more external or internal hard drives from Amazon for me.
customer_reviews.author: A. N. Lalwani

customer_reviews.title: Well made WD drive is it compatible with 2.0?
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this as a backup drive from my NAS using the USB port. The old WD Elements drive I had no problems with. After this had been on for a while the drive started clicking and it was a sign that is wasn't getting enough power, my old drive didn't have this problem. I used a adapter that allows you to use both USB sockets and its working fine. This hasn't been tested on a PC with a 2.0 port so it maybe compatible with 2.0 but my NAS drive didn't like it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G. Tomlinson

customer_reviews.title: WD 8TB hardrives great for OSX
customer_reviews.text: So far, a month in, no issues to report. Reformatted on arrival to use as Mac OS Time-machine backups. Bought 2 while on special offer, so pound for pound exceedingly cheap for backup piece of mind, replacing 2 x 3TB WD Mybook backup HD that have served well for four years (they haven’t failed, but are being retired before they do).
customer_reviews.author: Philip

product_meta.title: 1.5TB WD Elements USB
product_meta.description: 1.5TB Western Digital 2.5-Inch USB3.0 portable hard drive is a lightweight design, this drive is the ideal companion for users on the go. Usb 3.0 connectivity means you can power up without carrying a bulky power cord and plug.
feature_bullets: Backed by a 2 years manufacturers Warranty
